Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility and internal flight alternative (IFA) findings
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Found inconsistencies in testimony and rejected explanations; credibility deemed lacking
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Persecution due to sexual orientation in Nigeria
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility and availability of internal flight alternative
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider immutable characteristics in IFA analysis
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Plausible explanations for inconsistencies, legal precedent on repression of immutable traits
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness of credibility and IFA findings
Crimes.Application_Factor: Claimant's sexual orientation as an immutable characteristic
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim denied based on credibility and IFA
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable credibility assessment and flawed IFA conclusion
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule that credibility findings must be reasonable; IFA cannot require repression of immutable characteristics
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Case remitted for re-determination by a different board member
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility and existence of internal flight alternative
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of documentary corroboration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Alleged misapprehension of evidence by decision maker
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent accounts regarding personal history and experiences
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging unreasonableness of decision
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Canadian immigration and refugee law, including jurisprudence on LGBTQ+ persecution
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Misapprehension or failure to address key evidence
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to properly assess credibility in light of context and precedent

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility assessment and reasonableness of adverse finding
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Adverse credibility finding based on inconsistent testimony and implausibility
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution as a homosexual in Nigeria
Crimes.Application_Error: Overly critical assessment without considering plausible explanations
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Plausible justifications for inconsistencies in testimony
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Presumption of truthfulness unless rebutted by clear evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: Inconsistencies in narrative affecting perceived credibility
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim denied due to lack of credibility
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule that credibility findings must be reasonable and not based on trivial inconsistencies
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Case remanded for reassessment by a new board member
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to fairly evaluate explanations provided by claimant
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Contradictions in testimony regarding personal experiences
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, case law on credibility in refugee claims
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Misapprehension of evidence or failure to engage with explanations
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to justify rejection of explanations for inconsistencies

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Use of false passport and its impact on credibility
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility based on use of false documents and inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: False French passport, oral testimony, contextual explanations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Persecution based on sexual orientation in Nigeria
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of false travel document and credibility implications
Crimes.Application_Error: Focus on deception without assessing justification for document use
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Explanations for using false passport (fear, incompetent counsel)
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Credibility must be assessed holistically, including context for document misuse
Crimes.Application_Factor: Possession and use of fraudulent travel document
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Claim denied due to credibility concerns stemming from false document
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable reliance on false document without evaluating mitigating factors
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Use of false documents may undermine credibility but requires contextual analysis
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Use of false passport and resulting credibility issues
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Authenticity and explanation of travel documents
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to fairly assess justification for document fraud
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Use of false French passport to enter Canada
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Deception related to entry method affecting overall reliability
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that use of false documents was necessitated by fear and poor legal advice
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, jurisprudence on document fraud in refugee claims
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Insufficient reasoning on why explanations were dismissed
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to assess plausibility of justification for false documents
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation under s. 40 IRPA due to false documents
